name: Need Help with a build for an Arelith Beginner
author: TychoVelius

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content:
1) PvM 

2) Level cap - 30

3) Race preference - Human, Wild Elf, or Wood Elf

4) Class preference - Fighter and Druid came to mind, but I think Druid tends to be best with more levels, sooo.... Also, no RDD. It takes special permission, and I hate it.

5) Melee preference - Two-handed sustained damage

6) Range preference - Probably Zen, based on other factors. If I do ranged combat.

7) Weapon preference - Greatsword or Halberd, because reach.

8) Maximum item enhancement - This is the information I was able to dredge up. http://wiki.arelith.com/Enchantment_basin

9) Spellcasting - I don't know enough about Arelith to really have a strong idea here. My thought is that since they cap certain buffs, I should probably want a bit more of a mix of offense and buff spells. I'd like an elemental or naturalistic focus.

10) Custom factors - Arelith, and everything that entails.


Looking for a woodsy reach fighter with some spellcasting for versatility. Playable from 3+, since Arelith does at least start you at 3, it just takes hours to get to 4.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hey man, did you look at out sub-forum for 30th level builds yet? With just a glance I spotted seven different builds there with the "Arelith" keyword in front of them. And if you actually use the search function you will find a lot more threads with builds in them for that PW. If you want something out of the box though, we will be glad to help you.

level 30 builds => mid-epic-level-30-builds-f7/

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content: I did look there, nothing seemed quite what I was looking for. I might be interpreting builds wrong, or I might be too picky, or I might be looking for an archetype that doesn't really play well in NWN, but searching didn't bring me anything that seemed to fit the concept.

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content: Barbarian is an acceptable substitute for Fighter. Might fit the theme better, as well.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
What exactly is not to your style in this build?

Arelith Weapon-Master => arelith-sword-master-fighter-10-rogue-4 ... .html#p785

He is a human, with big, sustained damage, a fighter-weapon-master (the ideal form of a fighter) and you can change his weapon to whatever you like, take a greatsword and you will hit even harder. He even has UMD so he can use magical scrolls & other devices. More than that, rogue also provide him with evasion & full tumble for better armour class. Making him a barbarian is more a matter of how you present him rather that of the build. This build has absolutely top-notch AB & Damage, it is designed specifically for that. Perhaps if you could explain us better why this isn't to your liking then we should be able to help you more.

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content:
Ah, I was overlooking UMD as a casting alternative.

Yeah, that should work.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Glad you like it!

This character armed with a halberd will be devastating to his opponents (X4 criticals).

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content:
Could do spear and shield as well, if I'm reading the Arelith changes right, just gives up the bonus strength damage for two-handing, and the +2 AB for the same.

Decent tradeoff.

With a build lined up, any suggestions on getting started in Arelith? Skal or Cordor? It's possible it's just supposed to be this slow, and I'm not used to it.
